result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lebaron Erion Bogan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lebaron Erion Bogan not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Lebaron Erion Bogan.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense just received an offer from the State and requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request. State to submit and order to produce for the defendant to appear in person. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Lebaron Erion Bogan in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Lebaron Erion Bogan.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant Lebaron Erion Bogan not in court, in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Alexander James Geocaris for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requested adjournment to allow time to go over discovery with defendant.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lebaron Erion Bogan in court with Attorney Jade K Hall; both appear by video.  Defendant Lebaron Erion Bogan in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Klahorst. Court took judicial notice of Racine case 22CF87. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. 
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Lebaron Erion Bogan in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Lebaron Erion Bogan in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 6037 North 62nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
